intro: Rondeletia aculeolata, commonly known as the prickly rondeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, often with small spines. Rondeletia aculeolata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and unique appearance.
